meanings.definition: To make something vertical or erect.
meanings.sent1: She was uprighting the bookshelf to stand straight.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys uprighting the fallen trees in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The cat was uprighting the wobbly chair for fun.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays were uprighting the wilted flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The construction worker was uprighting the leaning fence with precision.

meanings.definition: The act of setting something in an upright position.
meanings.sent1: The uprighting of the vase on the table was done carefully.
meanings.sent2: The team's job involved the uprighting of the fallen signpost.
meanings.sent3: The clown's act included the comical uprighting of the oversized hat.
meanings.sent4: The uprighting of the flag symbolized unity and strength.
meanings.sent5: The quick uprighting of the fallen banner caught everyone's attention.
